rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator package

Submodules

rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.communicator_node module

Communicator Node module.

This module defines the CommunicatorNode class, which manages communication-related devices (microphone, speaker, real-time reporter, and mission status notifier) in a ROS 2 node.

It publishes and subscribes to audio messages and simulates real-time audio capture and playback.

Classes:

CommunicatorNode: A ROS 2 node handling audio communication and mission reporting.

Functions:

main(args=None): Entry point to run the node.

Example

To run the node: >>> python communicator_node.py

rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.microphone module

Microphone module.

This module defines the Microphone class, which simulates the behavior of a microphone device with adjustable sensitivity and optional noise cancellation.

Classes:

Microphone: Represents a microphone device that can capture simulated audio data.

Example

>>> mic = Microphone()
>>> mic.activate()
>>> audio = mic.listen()
>>> print(audio)
>>> mic.deactivate()
class rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.microphone.Microphone(sensitivity=0.8, noise_cancellation=True)[source]

Bases: object

Simulated microphone device for capturing audio data.

sensitivity

Sensitivity level of the microphone (0.0 to 1.0).

Type:

float

noise_cancellation

Whether noise cancellation is enabled.

Type:

bool

microphone_name

Name of the microphone device.

Type:

str

active

Whether the microphone is currently active.

Type:

bool

activate()[source]

Activate the microphone, allowing it to capture audio.

deactivate()[source]

Deactivate the microphone, stopping it from capturing audio.

listen()[source]

Capture audio data using the microphone.

Returns:

Simulated audio data.

Return type:

str

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the microphone is not activated.

rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.mission_status_notification module

Mission Status Notification module.

This module defines the MissionStatusNotification class, which simulates a notifier for mission status updates based on an urgency threshold.

Classes:

MissionStatusNotification: Sends mission status notifications based on urgency.

Example

>>> notifier = MissionStatusNotification()
>>> notifier.activate()
>>> notifier.notify({"message": "Victim detected nearby.", "urgency": 0.8})
>>> notifier.notify({"message": "Scanning area...", "urgency": 0.4})
>>> notifier.deactivate()
class rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.mission_status_notification.MissionStatusNotification(urgency_threshold=0.7)[source]

Bases: object

Simulated mission status notifier that triggers alerts based on urgency levels.

urgency_threshold

Threshold (0.0 to 1.0) to classify a message as urgent.

Type:

float

active

Whether the notifier is currently active.

Type:

bool

notifier_name

Name of the notifier device.

Type:

str

activate()[source]

Activate the mission status notifier.

deactivate()[source]

Deactivate the mission status notifier.

notify(status)[source]

Send a mission status update.

Parameters:

status (dict) – A dictionary containing at least: - ‘message’ (str): The status message. - ‘urgency’ (float, optional): Urgency level (defaults to 0.5 if not provided).

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the notifier is not activated.

rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.real_time_reporter module

Real-Time Reporter module.

This module defines the RealTimeReporter class, which simulates a device that sends periodic real-time status updates.

Classes:

RealTimeReporter: Sends real-time status reports at a configured frequency.

Example

>>> reporter = RealTimeReporter()
>>> reporter.activate()
>>> reporter.report("All systems operational.")
>>> reporter.deactivate()
class rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.real_time_reporter.RealTimeReporter(report_frequency=5.0)[source]

rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.speaker module

Speaker module.

This module defines the Speaker class, which simulates an audio speaker that can play back messages at a configurable volume.

Classes:

Speaker: Simulates a speaker device capable of speaking and adjusting volume.

Example

>>> speaker = Speaker()
>>> speaker.activate()
>>> speaker.speak("Hello, survivor!")
>>> speaker.set_volume(7)
>>> speaker.deactivate()
class rescue_robot.rescue_communicator.rescue_communicator.speaker.Speaker(volume_level=5)[source]

Bases: object

Simulated speaker for playing audio messages.

deactivate()[source]

Set a new volume level for the speaker.
